channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2024070549
item.description:
Report X-2024070549

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: LORTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A box containing 4 gallons was found in the area, and it was determined to be wet. Following a swift assessment confirming the presence of hazardous materials, the box was promptly relocated to the designated hazardous materials storage area. Upon thorough examination, it was revealed that one of the bottles had a loose cap, resulting in spillage that contaminated and compromised the integrity of the other bottles.

item.title: Report E-2024070153
item.description:
Report E-2024070153

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-09
  • City: CHARLOTTESVILLE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 18597
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver overfilled the customer's storage tank. This caused approximately 40 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. A portion of the spilled diesel fuel was able to migrate to a nearby storm drain. Albermarle County Fire and Rescue and Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024070116
item.description:
Report X-2024070116

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: ROANOKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Loaded ethanol tank car UTLX 213167 was observed by a yard crew with liquid spilling from the around the manway during switching operations. The car was set out and a contractor called to investigate and remedy the leak. They found 6 of 8 manway swing bolts less than tool tight and signs of spillage around the manway. The manway was opened and a lid gasket was observed in good condition. The manway was closed and properly secured tool tight.
